techs.name: Diplomacy
techs.quote: 'Solon used to say that speech was the image of actions; that laws were like cobwebs, for that if any trifling or powerless thing fell into them, they held it fast; while if it were something weightier, it broke through them and was off.' - Diogenes

techs.name: Land Grants
techs.quote: Diogenes once begged alms of a statue, and, when asked why he did so, replied, 'To get practice in being refused.'

techs.name: Currency
techs.quote: 'War is not so much a matter of weapons as of money.' - Thucydides

techs.name: Riding
techs.quote: 'Man is the most intelligent of the animals - and the most silly.' - Diogenes

techs.name: Public Works
techs.quote: 'What have the Romans ever done for us?' - Monty Python's Life of Brian

techs.name: Citizen Levy
techs.quote: 'Something something wise and viral.' - Some privileged 'wise' person

techs.name: Masonry
techs.quote: When someone wished to know why Sparta didn't have any walls, Agesilaus pointed to the citizens in full armour and said, 'These are the Spartans' walls.'

techs.name: Construction
techs.quote: 'When I became king, I built much excellent. What had been built by my father, that I protected, and other building I added. What moreover I built, and what my father built, all that by the favor of Ahuramazda we built.' - Xerxes

techs.name: Optics
techs.quote: 'It is not enough to be industrious; so are the ants. What are you industrious about?.' - Henry David Thoreau

techs.name: Philosophy
techs.quote: 'You will become a teacher of yourself when you criticize yourself for all those things that you would criticize others.' - Diogenes

techs.name: Entertainment
techs.quote: 'Every generation laughs at the old fashions, but follows religiously the new.' - Henry David Thoreau

techs.name: Trade Routes
techs.quote: 'Something something wise and viral.' - Some privileged 'wise' person

techs.name: Equestrian Class
techs.quote: 'A Man is defined as a biped and featherless animal' said Plato, and he was applauded. Diogenes returned with a plucked chicken, shouting 'Behold Plato's man!'.

techs.name: Infantry Training
techs.quote: Philip II of Macedon sent a message to Sparta: 'If I invade Laconia you will be destroyed, never to rise again.'. The Spartan repply was 'If'.

techs.name: Engineering
techs.quote: 'I have found it!' - Archimedes, as he ran naked from his bath, having found a way to meassure the proportion of gold that was used in the king's crown

techs.name: Navigation
techs.quote: 'We have ploughed the vast ocean in a fragile bark.' - Ovid

techs.name: Cultural Exchange
uniques: Allied City-States provide [Culture] equal to [15]% of what they produce for themselves
Allied City-States provide [Science] equal to [15]% of what they produce for themselves
techs.quote: 'The most beautiful thing in the world is freedom of speech.' - Diogenes

techs.name: Tax Farming
uniques: Enables conversion of city production to [Gold]
techs.quote: 'The great thieves lead away the little thief.' - Diogenes

techs.name: Supply Logistics
uniques: [-25]% Gold cost of acquiring tiles [in all cities]
techs.quote: 'I will either find a way, or make one.' - Hannibal Barca

techs.name: Heavy Infantry
techs.quote: 'Something something wise and viral.' - Some privileged 'wise' person

techs.name: Torsion Engines
techs.quote: 'Shall we not make an end to this fighting against this geometrical Briareus who uses our ships like cups to ladle water from the sea, drives off our sambuca ignominiously with cudgel-blows, and by the multitude of missiles that he hurls at us all at once outdoes the hundred-handed giants of mythology?' - Marcus Claudius Marcellus, during the Siege of Syracuse

techs.name: Naval Artillery
techs.quote: 'Children ought to be provided with property and resources of a kind that could swim with them even out of a shipwreck.' - Vitruvius

techs.name: Vassalage
uniques: Comment [Increased Bonuses from friendly and allied City-States]
Allied City-States will occasionally gift Great People
techs.quote: 'Aristotle dines when it seems good to King Philip, but Diogenes when he himself pleases.' - Diogenes

techs.name: Private Estates
techs.quote: 'Virtue cannot dwell with wealth either in a city or in a house.' - Diogenes

techs.name: Metallurgy
techs.quote: 'Boasting, like gilded armour, is very different inside from outside.' - Diogenes

techs.name: Social Reforms
uniques: Enables conversion of city production to [Culture]
[-10]% Culture cost of adopting new Policies
techs.quote: 'The rulers of the States are the only ones who should have the privilege of lying' - Plato, promoting an early manifestation of fascism

techs.name: Aesthetics
techs.quote: 'The perception of beauty is a moral test.' - Henry David Thoreau

techs.name: Military Reforms
techs.quote: 'The man who despairs in the face of difficulties and hardships, or of public censure and opinion, is defeated by his own feebleness.' - Cleomenes III

techs.name: Mass Production
techs.quote: 'It is the privilege of the gods to want nothing, and of godlike men to want little.' - Diogenes

techs.name: Exploration
uniques: Enables [Embarked] units to enter ocean tiles
techs.quote: 'Something something wise and viral.' - Some privileged 'wise' person

techs.name: Imperial Decay
techs.quote: 'I think we agree, the past is over.' - George W. Bush

civilopediaText.text: Who knows what the future holds?
